creator: lyz@safeland.com
text:
Symptom:
when authencating on an Active Directory, if an authentication fails,
the following authentications will fail too, even if the user gives
the correct user name and password.

Reason:
Actually, this bug is between mod_ldap (util_ldap.c) & mod_auth_ldap.
Active Directory requires a successful bind before the search, if
the user enters a wrong password once, mod_auth_ldap issues a failed
bind, then the status of this LDAP CONNECTION is mark as anonymous,
and is not allow to search again in the following authentications,
and util_ldap defines a connection pool, so this failed connection
will always be used.
see bug 27134 and the patch in attachment id=11296 by Denis Gervalle
